chapter.title: Distribution Setup
chapter.para: This document describes ways to set up an entire distribution, including release management, update stack and service pack generation support.

section.title: General Project Setup for a Maintained Distribution
Setting Up a Project Re-Using Other Projects Sources
Contributing to Foreign Projects Directly
section.para: In case a user does not have commit permissions to a project, they can request maintainership permissions to this project. This makes sense if the user is already known to the project owners and they trust them as a maintainer. There is a way to do this via the request system of OBS, but only via osc so far: # osc createrequest -a add_me maintainer PROJECT

section.title: Contributing to Foreign Projects Indirectly
section.para: Users who are new to a certain project, either because they are new users at all or do not have any deeper knowledge about this certain project don't have direct commit permissions. However, they can still create a copy of any package source and ask back to merge their changes. Open Build Service has support to make this easy.
